bibl.title: Celebrating Supermen: Divine Honors for Roman Emperors in Greek Papyri from Egypt.
bibl.note: Introduction. - Roman rule represented. - Organisation and presence of Roman emperor cult. - Augustan days: ἡμέραι σεβασταί. - The imperial oath. - Imperial titulature. - The impact of imperial divinity in Roman Egypt.

bibl.title: More than Men, Less than Gods. Studies on Royal Cult and Imperial Worship. Proceedings of the International Colloquium Organized by the Belgian School at Athens (November 1-2, 2007)

bibl.seg: De Jong Janneke, Celebrating Supermen: Divine Honors for Roman Emperors in Greek Papyri from Egypt.

Panagiotis P. Iossif, Andrzej S. Chankowski and Catharine C. Lorber (Edd.), More than Men, Less than Gods. Studies on Royal Cult and Imperial Worship. Proceedings of the International Colloquium Organized by the Belgian School at Athens (November 1-2, 2007) = Studia Hellenistica. 51 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, Mass., 2011) pp. 619-647.

Introduction. - Roman rule represented. - Organisation and presence of Roman emperor cult. - Augustan days: ἡμέραι σεβασταί. - The imperial oath. - Imperial titulature. - The impact of imperial divinity in Roman Egypt.
